intro: Erisma djalma-batistae, commonly known as the Djalma-Batista's erisma, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in a fine layer of pubescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Erisma djalma-batistae is considered a species of conservation concern.
